definition: to convince the masses
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]

sentences.english: Ye Gongjin said it would be hard for them to kill both of them.
sentences.chinese: 叶公瑾说要是把她们俩都杀了恐怕难以服众。

sentences.english: Then again, where indicators on these are available, there are hardly encouraging.
sentences.chinese: 其次，当有迹象显示即便可采用，此举也难以服众。

sentences.english: However, the study wasn't fastidious in its parameters.
sentences.chinese: 然而，该研究的参数却是难以服众的。

sentences.english: Their absence results in a book that is too crude to be convincing.
sentences.chinese: 但他们的疏漏也使得本书太过粗略而难以服众。

sentences.english: But his saying of "not representing any interest group" would be hardly convinced.
sentences.chinese: 但赵先生说他不代表利益集团，恐怕难以服众。

sentences.english: Ceng Nianan think great smoky Han Jinquan smoked for ten years, cant.
sentences.chinese: 曾念安认为韩金铨抽了十年大烟，不能服众。

definition: to have faith in/to believe in/to have confidence in/to respect
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
(of a title, degree etc) illegitimately conferred

definition: to manage to suppress/to keep under control
to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
lit. to go to war without just cause (idiom)/to act without justification
reliable evidence (idiom); conclusive proof/definitive evidence
qualifications/experience/seniority
prestige
public opinion
acceptable/passable/justifiable/(of a course of action) to make sense
(idiom) what lowly people think counts for little
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to make a definitive judgment/to come to a firm conclusion
to dispute/to refute
to make a decision/to determine
